to have waived her Fifth Amendment Privilege, was informed of the
’s decision of waiver, and continued to refuse to testify before the
, Ms. Lerner shall be found to be in contempt of Congress for failure to comply with a congressional subpoena.

text.#text: That because Lois G. Lerner, former Director, Exempt Organizations,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall certify the report of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , detailing the refusal of Ms. Lerner to testify before the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as directed by subpoena, to the United States Attorney for the District of Columbia, to the end that Ms. Lerner be proceeded against in the manner and form provided by law.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall otherwise take all appropriate action to enforce the subpoena.
